release.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to let someone go free, after having kept them somewhere
release.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Police arrested several men, who were later released.
The bears are eventually released into the wild.
He was released from the hospital yesterday.
release.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to let news or official information be known and printed
release.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: The new trade figures have just been released.
release.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to make a CD, film, computer game etc available for people to buy or see
release.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: A version of the game for Mac computers will be released in February.
release.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to stop holding or drop something
release.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Thousands of bombs were released over Dresden.
The sudden noise made him release his hold on her arm.
release.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to express or get rid of feelings such as anger or worry
release.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: Physical exercise is a good way of releasing stress.
release.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to let a substance flow out
release.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: Oil was released into the sea.
release.translation[0].definitions[6].de: to allow someone not to do their duty or work
release.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: Because of rising costs, the company released 10% of their workforce.
Williams asked to be released from her contract.
release.translation[0].definitions[7].de: to allow part of a piece of machinery or equipment to move from the position in which it is fastened or held
release.translation[1].definitions[0].de: when someone is officially allowed to go free, after being kept somewhere
release.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Before release, the sea lions are fitted with electronic tracking devices.
Simon has obtained early release from prison.
release.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a new CD, film, computer game etc that is available to buy or see
release.translation[1].definitions[2].de: if a film is on release, you can go and see it in a cinema
release.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: The film is on general release.
release.translation[1].definitions[3].de: freedom to show or express your feelings
release.translation[1].definitions[3].ex: Playing an instrument can be a form of emotional release.
release.translation[1].definitions[4].de: a feeling that you are free from the worry or pain that you have been suffering
release.translation[1].definitions[4].ex: treatment that will bring a release from pain
release.translation[1].definitions[5].de: when a chemical, gas etc is allowed to flow out of its usual container
release.translation[1].definitions[5].ex: the release of toxic waste into the rivers
release.translation[1].definitions[6].de: an official statement, report etc that is made available to be printed or broadcast, or the act of making it available
release.translation[1].definitions[6].ex: October 22nd is the date set for the report’s release.
release.translation[1].definitions[7].de: a handle, button etc that can be pressed to allow part of a machine to move
release.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to make information, figures etc publicly available
release.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: The company will release its latest earnings figures on Wednesday.
release.translation[2].definitions[1].de: to make a new product, especially a film, book, or record, available for people to buy or see
release.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: The film will be released on DVD next week.
release.translation[2].definitions[2].de: to allow someone to stop working for you
release.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: He asked to be released from his contract.
release.translation[2].definitions[3].de: to make money available to be used
release.translation[2].definitions[3].ex: the need to release the money for grants
release.translation[3].definitions[0].de: an official statement, making information publicly available
release.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: In a joint news release, the companies said no agreement had been reached.
release.translation[3].definitions[1].de: a new product, especially a film, book, or record, or the fact that it is available
release.translation[3].definitions[1].ex: The company is hoping to keep ahead of the market by bringing out anew release of its operating system.
The movie has taken $5.1 million since its release.
The film will beon general release (=available in most places) on August 3.
